chart_description: This chart displays the memory allocated to system pools in bytes on a Windows machine. The memory is divided into two dimensions - non-paged and paged memory.

dimension_descriptions.non-paged: Non-paged memory is allocated to system processes and cannot be paged out to disk, which may cause a system crash if the memory becomes full.
dimension_descriptions.paged: Paged memory is allocated to user processes and can be paged out to disk if necessary, making it less critical than non-paged memory.
